description: A prehistoric island frozen in time, populated by dinosaurs and massive plant life. The island exists millions of years behind other locations due to its extreme climate. Named 'Little Garden' by explorer Louis Arnote.

keyMoments.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Little Garden
keyMoments.description: The Going Merry arrives at Little Garden, and the crew immediately notices unusual roaring sounds and massive jungle vegetation.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of the Little Garden arc and the crew's encounter with this unique prehistoric environment.

keyMoments.title: Little Garden's Prehistoric Nature Revealed
keyMoments.description: The island is revealed to be populated by dinosaurs and massive plant life, frozen in a prehistoric time period.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Little Garden as one of the Grand Line's most unique and dangerous islands.

notableFeatures.description: The island is frozen in prehistoric time with dinosaurs and ancient plant life still thriving.
Requires a full year for the Log Pose to set, the longest recording time shown so far in the series.
Dense jungle with vegetation that dwarfs normal islands, creating a primeval forest environment.

reveals.information: Little Garden is a prehistoric island on the Grand Line with dinosaurs and ancient creatures
Named by explorer Louis Arnote, who documented the island's unique nature
According to historical accounts, no one who visited the island has ever returned

description: A tropical vacation island featuring hotels, palm trees, and resort facilities. Used by Baroque Works agents as a leisure destination between missions. The name derives from the Japanese word for 'vacation' or 'holiday'.

keyMoments.title: Kyuka Island Vacation Resort Debut
keyMoments.description: Kyuka Island is shown as a tropical resort where Mr. 3 and Miss Goldenweek are vacationing between Baroque Works missions.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that even criminal organizations like Baroque Works provide downtime for their agents.

notableFeatures.description: Hotels, beaches, and recreational areas designed for relaxation.
Used as a designated vacation location for Baroque Works agents during their time off.
Features palm trees, umbrella-shaped trees, and mountain architecture with balconies and swimming pools.

reveals.information: Kyuka Island serves as a vacation resort for Baroque Works agents
Baroque Works provides structured vacation time for its agents
